intro: Asperula allionii, commonly known as the alpine evergreen azalea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, humid climates. It is often found in alpine meadows and forested areas at high elevations. Asperula allionii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its hardy nature and aesthetic beauty.
